text.div:
AbnormalityDensityCS CodeSystem

Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) is the presence of abnormal cells inside a milk duct in the breast. DCIS is considered the earliest form of breast cancer. DCIS is noninvasive, meaning it hasn't spread out of the milk duct and has a low risk of becoming invasive.

name: AbnormalityDensityCS
title: AbnormalityDensityCS
description:
Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) is the presence of abnormal cells inside a milk duct in the breast.
DCIS is considered the earliest form of breast cancer. DCIS is noninvasive, meaning it hasn't spread out of the milk duct and has a low risk of becoming invasive.

concept.definition: These are rounded calcifications with a lucent center usually representing dermal calcifications. Larger calcifications with lucent centers may be due to oil cysts/fat necrosis and may follow surgery or trauma.
concept.display: These are rounded calcifications with a lucent center usually representing dermal calcifications. Larger calcifications with lucent centers may be due to oil cysts/fat necrosis and may follow surgery or trauma.

concept.definition: X-ray attenuation of the mass is the same as the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.
concept.display: X-ray attenuation of the mass is the same as the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.

concept.definition: Includes all masses containing fat, such as oil cyst, lipoma, or galactocele as well as mixeddensity lesions such as hamartoma.
concept.display: Includes all masses containing fat, such as oil cyst, lipoma, or galactocele as well as mixeddensity lesions such as hamartoma.

concept.definition: X-ray attenuation of the mass is grater than the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.
concept.display: X-ray attenuation of the mass is grater than the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.

concept.definition: X-ray attenuation of the mass is less than the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.
concept.display: X-ray attenuation of the mass is less than the expected attenuation of an equal volume of fibroglandular breast tissue.
